meanings.definition: Mentally sound; possessing a rational mind.
meanings.sent1: She made a sane decision after carefully thinking about it.
meanings.sent2: It is sane to consider all options before making a choice.
meanings.sent3: The idea of wearing a swimsuit in the snow seemed quite sane to her.
meanings.sent4: His approach to problem-solving was as clear and sane as a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: Her calm and sane demeanor in a crisis situation was admirable.

meanings.sent1: It was a sane choice to bring an umbrella on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: His suggestion was quite sane and well thought out.
meanings.sent3: The cat's decision to chase a mouse was not very sane.
meanings.sent4: Her advice was as sane as a lighthouse guiding ships in the night.
meanings.sent5: The decision to invest in that company seemed quite sane at the time.

meanings.definition: Free from mental disorder; not insane.
meanings.sent1: The doctor confirmed that the patient was sane and lucid.
meanings.sent2: It is important to ensure that all jurors are sane during a trial.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking unicorn was definitely not sane.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was as clear and sane as a crystal-clear lake.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time travel seemed too wild to be sane to him.
